intro: Linociera philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a smooth texture, making it a distinctive species in its native habitat.
